title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 27 May 2014 - XWiki
content:
has quit 01:10  has joined #xwiki 04:32  has joined #xwiki 05:15  has joined #xwiki 06:03  has quit 07:36  has joined #xwiki 07:51  has joined #xwiki 08:03  has joined #xwiki 08:22  has joined #xwiki 08:24  has joined #xwiki 08:31  has joined #xwiki 08:31  Hi guys, a quick question about $blacklistedspaces, is there some function that sets this when you hide the application panel? 08:32  not using it makes all the spaces in there as part of the $blacklistedspaces array 08:32  I can't seem to find anything that does this in the .vm files either 08:39  has joined #xwiki 08:43  has joined #xwiki 08:47  has quit 08:47  has joined #xwiki 08:51  has joined #xwiki 08:53  http://parall.ax/products/jspdf <-- just showed up in my inbox 08:54  https://github.com/MrRio/jsPDF 08:56  has quit 08:56  has quit 08:57  has joined #xwiki 08:58  Good morning, I have a short questions regarding the CSS Styles and the wysiwyg editor. 09:00  has quit 09:00  kaisen: everybody is holding their breath waiting for you to ask the actual question xD 09:01  I set the body class to margin-right: auto;margin-left: auto; which works fine for me 09:01  But the wysiwyg submenues doesn't like that setting 09:01  what exactly are you centering? 09:02  The whole wiki 09:02  hmm 09:02  I limit the maximum width 09:03  unfortunately it seems the wysiwyg is calculating the submenu position and I don't know where or how 09:04  CSS... my standard method is to screw with it until it works. You might ask mflorea since he did the original wysiwyg editor 09:05  I screw with it alot :-) 09:06  mflorea: you remember how the wysiwyg calculates positions of submenus? 09:07  Thats what I end up 09:07  http://de.zimagez.com/zimage/screenshot-27052014-090607.php 09:08  http://de.zimagez.com/zimage/screenshot-27052014-090730.php 09:09  oh yeah, that's annoying :) 09:10  has quit 09:10  has joined #xwiki 09:10  kaisen: play with position: relative on your containers. Usually that's how you position things, but the solution depends on the CSS you've added and your containers. 09:11  I think the problem is that the is centered but the wysiwyg is locating it's menus against something unknown 09:12  Ok until no I didn't touch the containers - I will have a try 09:13  Anyone have any idea about the $blacklistedspaces getting set for all spaces in the application panel when you hide it? 09:13  cjd: theoretically the wysiwyg can be centered also in XWiki, when using the both panels sides 09:13  teekay: I don't - sorry 09:15  indeed, I was able to center a wysiwyg editor.. but I was not centering the entire wiki 09:15  #css #magic 09:15  teekay: Applications Panel should not have any impact on the blacklisted, maybe the error is somewhere else 09:15  bandaid solution of declaring it before I use it works but.. i'm just curious as to why this happens 09:16  yea maybe, i dont think i touched it anywhere in my skins either but i guess i'll have a closer look again. Just wanted to know if there was something through Panels that did something 09:16  Did the Blacklist still work? I thought you need to hidden all pages in a space to hide the space 09:16  it does work 09:17  you can either declare it in xwikivars.vm or specify it in your velocity script 09:17  but my one gets overwritten somewhere and i don't know where :/ 09:17  I tried to edit the xwikivars.vm but the Spaces where shown all time 09:18  I just know that you need to disable the show hidden content in your profile 09:18  check whether xwikivars.vm is overridden for the skin you're using (colibri) 09:18  has joined #xwiki 09:18  you might be editing one which is inactive 09:19  does colibri overwrite it? 09:19  you'd have to look, I forgot 09:26  has joined #xwiki 09:36  has joined #xwiki 09:42  kaisen: the CSS for the WYSIWYG editor menus is in resources/js/xwiki/wysiwyg/xwe/stylesheets/Wysiwyg.css . I don't remember exactly how the menus calculate the position, but you should look at their CSS. 09:44  @mflorea thx 09:46  has quit 09:47  has joined #xwiki 10:05  has joined #xwiki 10:25  is now known as 10:36  vmassol: I have rebuilt enterprise at home 10:36  and I still have the problem with webjars 10:36  ok let me download from maven 10:36  maybe a dep is missing somewhere 10:37  or maybe the CI hasn't rebuild everything yet 10:37  have you rebuilt the mdules I mentioned? 10:37  (the 3 set of modules) 10:43  Coming back to my style "problem" I had earlier - unfortunately I cannot get rid of it as the css settings are overwriten all the time. would be great if someone can tell me where the calculation is comming from 10:50  vmassol: nope, because I get it from maven 10:50  vmassol: I'll try 10:52  [ANN] myxwiki.org is upgraded to 6.0.1 with SOLR back 10:57  crossing fingers.... 11:02  vmassol: still the problem after compiling resources, url and webjars 11:03  vmassol: http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/webjars/resources/path?value=bootstrap/3.1.1/js/bootstrap.js -> http://hastebin.com/uviteworux.js 11:05  myxwiki.org seems in good shape so far, main wiki UI upgrade went well 11:05  (usually it was unusable very fast) 11:05  gdelhumeau: just downloaded a snapshot and it works well here :) 11:05  wait 11:05  your last pastebin looks ok too 11:06  no 11:06  what's wrong with http://hastebin.com/uviteworux.js ? 11:06  look at the end 11:06  ah ok 11:06  didn't understand that the problme was the end 11:07  fixing 11:09  thx :) 11:17  gdelhumeau: ok found the problem 11:18  good 11:29  ok works committing 11:32  [myxwiki.org] Java memory used: 674 Mb / 1,344 Mb 11:32  gdelhumeau: should be ok now, you can just rebuild oldcore if you wish 11:32  myxwiki.org never been lighter 11:32  :) 11:32  thanks vmassol 11:32  sorry about that 11:32  np 11:32  missing some functional tests for it 11:32  just unit tests for webjars 11:32  I tolf you because I've seen it 11:32  probably deserver a 6.0.2... 11:32  \*told 11:33  6.0.2? 11:33  this is is only in 6.1 11:33  6.1M2 to be precise 11:33  (if we're talking about the same thing ;)) 11:34  (ie the webjars issue) 11:34  has joined #xwiki 11:34  i'm talking about what I was talking about 11:34  hey le too! 11:34  \*me 11:34  not participating to your discussion 11:34  what deserves a 6.0.2? 11:34  I thought you upgraded to 6.0.1? 11:34  (with the fix) 11:35  there's anotehr fix? 11:35  6.0.1 plus http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10382 11:35  ok 11:35  thought it was in 6.0.1... 11:35  I was thinkin about 6.0.2 yesterday 11:35  this one being for the title only (6.0.1 has a fix for panels, ui extensions, etc) 11:35  and wondering if we need one or just wait for 6.1 11:36  note that it's not like it was a recent regression 11:36  (6.1 or just 6.1M2) 11:36  we have the issue since we render title with a velocity template 11:36  which is probably a veeeery long time 11:37  what changed in myxwiki.org is probably some new wiki with insane titles 11:37  tmortagne: is it normal that i don't see any commits for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10382 ? 11:37  (in the commits tab) 11:37  is the commits tab broken again? 11:37  yes that's what happen when you use the wrong jira issue in the commit... 11:37  ah ok 11:37  :) 11:37  maybe you could comment 11:38  yea 11:38  in case someone watns to see teh commit 11:38  (I wanted to see quickly what it was about ;)) 11:38  ah it's in my unread mails anyway 11:40  done 11:43  thx 11:44  tmortagne: crash of myxwiki.org 11:44  yes I saw it 11:45  but not a memory issue this time 11:45  there is something else 11:45  it's the "locked <0x00000000ba5776c8> (a org.apache.tomcat.util.net.SocketWrapper)" I saw last time 11:46  it's tomcat internal so hard to say what's wrong exactly 11:48  it seems related a lot to network access 11:49  there is even thread in blocked state that don't have XWiki anywyere in their stack 11:50  putting jdk-7u55 11:53  has quit 12:28  has quit 12:36  has joined #xwiki 12:39  vmassol: problem sove indeed 13:07  has joined #xwiki 13:22  gdelhumeau: cool 13:49  vmassol: in case you didn't notice 13:49  [ERROR] 7004: com.xpn.xwiki.store.XWikiHibernateBaseStore: In method 'protected void createHibernateSequenceIfRequired(java.lang.String, org.hibernate.Session)' the number of arguments has changed 13:49  argh it's suposed to be internal completely 13:49  ok ficing thanks 13:49  \*fixing 13:49  np 13:54  has joined #xwiki 13:57  has quit 14:19  tmortagne: thanks! 14:19  otp 14:39  has joined #xwiki 15:13  has joined #xwiki 15:31  has joined #xwiki 15:33  has quit 15:33  is now known as 15:42  vmassol: the best quote template I've ever seen is on ED... but if I gave you a link your life would never be the same :S 15:42  :) 15:43  they use a very large silver/grey double quote symbol in the upper left and an upside-down one in the lower right (iirc) 15:43  it's been a while 15:44  @cjd sorry for bothering you with the wysiwyg editor, but I nearly checked everything but with no result. With layerd css it doesn't work as the drop down is added on demand and load it afterwords. I know the variable I need to change but now where :( Maybe you have an idea where I could find it. The gtw-MenubarPopup is loaded with style=" position: absolute" I need to change it to "position: fixed" 15:45  you want to hear my answer? :) 15:45  hehe better not :-) 15:45  hint it involves jquery and a very large hammer 15:46  otherwise, dealing with style attributes injected by GWT is going to be tough 15:47  the settings in the Wysiwyg.css are overwritten by something that generate the popup 15:47  yup, the wysiwyg editor is all written in GWT (java compiled to javascript) 15:48  but I don't know what it is. I checked a lot of .js files where "position" is inside. I exchange a lot of "absolute" entries with "fixed" but it is still somerwhere I haven't 15:48  has quit 15:49  so \*maybe\* it's something you can do with CSS, otherwise you'd have to either take my bad advice or submit a bug report and/or patch to the Wysiwyg to not create silly style= html attributes 15:49  And what is your bad advice? 15:50  hang on a sec... 15:50  k 15:50  kaisen: cjd I don't think is WYSIWYG fault. Junco (a skin done by me) is having a centered layout and I haven't had any problem with the WYSIWYG styling. I'm sure is kaisen code somewhere. 15:51  ahh cool 15:51  http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Junco+Skin#HTheme:Blueberry … it is centered. 15:52  Anyway if all else fails, the big hammer is something like this: require(['jquery'], function ($) { document.observe('xwiki:wysiwyg:created', function() { $('#gwt-whatever').css({position:'fixed'}); }); }); 15:52  kaisen: I don't think is a good idea to start modifying internal WYSIWYG code and replace position: absolute with fixed. Do you know what position:fixed does? 15:52  I don't recommend it though :) 15:52  no but it help to show the drop down on the right postion for me :D 15:53  :) 15:53  CSS debugging is hard .. I know … and takes lots of experimentation sometimes. 15:54  kaisen: you said that it's actually a
in the html ? 15:54  yes I had to lear that... but I have just added margin-left: auto;margin-right: auto; to the body class 15:56  
Insert Table...
15:56  that's what the insert-table dropdown looks like for me 15:56  no explicit style attributes 15:58  @cjd yes. class="gwt-MenuBarPopup" style="left: 653px; top: 313px; visibility: visible; position: absolute; overflow: visible;" 15:59  has joined #xwiki 15:59  if it's calculated style, keep poking around in the css files, also examine the skin evalica linked to 15:59  This is what added as soon you click on a menu and than analyse the css 16:00  I will check the junco scheme 16:00  maybe some other js is doing it because it doesn't happen for me 16:01  5.4.5 won't be the last version of the 5.4.x branch? 16:02  it won't 16:03  not with the new voted strategy from yesterday :) 16:03  (gdelhumeau\_) 16:03  see http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Support 16:03  yes 16:03  But I was hopping no more bugs will be discovered in this branch ^^ 16:03  only critical bugs should go there yes 16:04  ...implying critical bugs will be discovered xD 16:04  of course 16:04  some are even already listed on jira.xwiki.org :) 16:04  ahh ok 16:05  actually some non critical bugs can also go there 16:05  the rule is more: no risk on that branch 16:05  it has to remain super stable 16:15  has quit 16:16  has quit 16:17  has joined #xwiki 16:17  has left #xwiki 16:19  has joined #xwiki 16:35  has quit 16:39  has joined #xwiki 17:00  has quit 18:02  has quit 18:04  has quit 18:05  has quit 18:10  has quit 18:14  has quit 18:15  has quit 18:18  has joined #xwiki 19:14  has quit 19:24  has quit 19:27  has quit 19:39  has joined #xwiki 19:40  has quit 19:41  has joined #xwiki 19:42  hi there! need help creating an eventlistener for document update or creation i xwiki 6 19:42  has quit 19:43  can't do it with: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Observation+Module+Local#HConsumingandproducingevents 19:43  vierfzweievieraz: in java or in a wiki page? 19:44  has quit 19:44  i want i want to achieve is to manipulate the contentt from a page once the user press save 19:44  sure that's easy :) 19:44  in java 19:44  ok 19:44  what's the problem? 19:45  can't find any example 19:45  can't get it done 19:45  the link you gave is an example 19:45  sure, but the classes can't be found no where either then https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/blob/master/xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-observation/xwiki-commons-observation-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/observation/AbstractEventListener.java 19:45  i am using the archetype for a component 19:46  so you're using a maven pom right? 19:46  right 19:46  and you've included the observation dependency? 19:47  xwiki-commons-observation-local 19:47  actually just the api is enough: 19:47  observation dependency!? don't know about that 19:47  xwiki-commons-observation-api 19:47  if you don't have any dep then your code won't complie :) 19:47  has joined #xwiki 19:47  i am using the maven  component archetype 19:47  i know 19:48  i can't find the mentioned class above in any dependency 19:48  the AbstractEventListener class you mentioned above 19:48  is located in the xwiki-commons-observation-api JAR 19:49  ... addding ... 19:49  groupid: org.xwiki.commons 19:49  acrtifactid: xwiki-commons-observation-api 19:49  version: the version of XWiki you're building for 19:49  nope 19:49  did not work 19:49  you'll also need to add the xwiki-platform-oldcore dep later on 19:49  seams not to be there at all 19:49       org.xwiki.commons 19:49       6.1-milestone-1 19:50  it is there 19:50  :) 19:50  it's in even in maven central 19:50  let me get the url 19:50  you know whats funny i could not find this class in any javadoc of the version 6 either 19:51  see http://central.maven.org/maven2/org/xwiki/commons/xwiki-commons-component-api/6.1-milestone-1/ 19:51  that's for maven central 19:51  it's also in the xwiki maven remote repo of course 19:51  the class? 19:51  could not find it 19:52  can not find it 19:52  https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/blob/xwiki-commons-6.1-milestone-1/xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-observation/xwiki-commons-observation-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/observation/AbstractEventListener.java 19:52  you can see it's in there 19:52  you can also do a tar tvf on http://central.maven.org/maven2/org/xwiki/commons/xwiki-commons-component-api/6.1-milestone-1/xwiki-commons-component-api-6.1-milestone-1.jar 19:52  to check that it's there 19:52  I am except that I used the 6.1M1 link 19:52  since that's what you're using 19:53  for the maven project i need that in a release, maven dependency? 19:53  the link you posted was for master 19:53  oh 19:53  (ie 6.1-SNAPSHOT which will be released as 6.1-milestone-2 in a few weeks) 19:54  so i will have to add the version 6.1-milestone-1-SNAPSHOT to get the class from the xwiki-commons-observation-api !? 19:54  no 19:55  your dep was ok 19:55  pls tell me which dependency i have to add.... 19:55  i am lost.... 19:55  again what you did was ok 19:56  https://gist.github.com/vmassol/14cfa2ab96e108d961ca 19:56  but if it was ok, why there is not any class org.xwiki.bridge.event.AbstractDocumentEvent in any of the dependencys? 19:56  you're confgusing everything 19:57  you asked one question above: 19:57  "sure, but the classes can't be found no where either then https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/blob/master/xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-observation/xwiki-commons-observation-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/observation/AbstractEventListener.java" 19:57  I am answering this question 19:57  now you're asking a different question 19:57  which is: "where is org.xwiki.bridge.event.AbstractDocumentEvent located?" 19:57  ok 19:57  thx 19:58  this one is in: 19:58  xwiki-platform-bridge 19:58  org.xwiki.platform 19:59  the secondhttp://search.maven.org/#search|ga|1|org.xwiki.platform 19:59  it's NOT in maven central 19:59  that's my problem, it can't be found in maven central:http://search.maven.org/#search|ga|1|org.xwiki.platform 19:59  as I told you above ;) 20:00  I think you're missing one doc 20:00  http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building 20:00  read this part: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building#HInstallingMaven 20:00  I'm sure you haven't defined the xwiki remote repository in your maven setuyp 20:01  so your maven is only looking for deps in maven central 20:01  now i get it 20:01  you need the xwiki remote repo to defined in your maven's settings.xml 20:02  ok, thank you 20:02  np 20:02  why you so patient? :) 20:03  do you live in europe? 20:03  :D 20:03  yes 20:03  france 20:03  austria 20:03  cool 20:03  you just took my frustration away 20:03  cool 20:04  (deep breath) thx again 20:04  btw you could also do this in a wiki page without java, might be simpler for you, see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/WikiComponent+Module 20:05  thx, but i want the hard way,  so i learn more about xwiki 20:05  ok :) 20:21  has quit 20:36  has joined #xwiki 21:07  has quit 21:12  has joined #xwiki 21:40  has quit 21:42  has joined #xwiki 21:46  has quit 21:48  has joined #xwiki 22:59  has quit 23:13  has joined #xwiki 23:17  has quit 23:34  has quit 23:50  has joined #xwiki
